sub_topic: Finding the Ramsey number of a graph.
message_1: What is the Ramsey number R(4,4)? In other words, what is the minimum number of vertices required in a graph such that either a set of 4 vertices contain a complete graph of order 4 or its complement contains a complete graph of order 4?
message_2: The Ramsey number R(4,4) is 18. This means that in a graph with 18 vertices, either a set of 4 vertices will form a complete graph of order 4 (a clique of 4 vertices, where every vertex is connected to every other vertex), or its complement will contain a complete graph of order 4 (a set of 4 vertices where no two vertices are connected).
